text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something Angry Birds Themed!

The new movie is coming out in just a couple of
days and I’m really excited, I love

Angry Birds! And, I also got requests to do
something easy mode.

You guys were wanting something a little bit
more easy, so today, we’re gonna

be making a very yummy and simple snack, we’re
gonna be making

Angry Birds Cheese and Crackers. Let’s get
started!

The things you will need, will be: Some Babybel
cheeses, entertainment crackers,

black olives. You’re gonna need 2 cheeses,
1 being yellow, 1 being white, I’m using

cheddar and provolone but you can use whatever
1 you’d like.

A little mini leaf cutter, and then 2 tips,
this 1 is a #2A and a #363.
Now let’s put it all together!

These snacks are super easy to make, and they’re
adorable!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is cut
up our olives.

And you’re gonna cut it the long way, cut
it into fourths.
Cut him again, here we go!

Now take a small, sharp cutting knife, be
careful of your fingers, and we are gonna

filet our olives. This is so funny, we’re
gonna cut out the meat of the olive,

by keeping the knife nice and flat and
sliding it through.
Just be really careful, don’t get your fingers!
I’m 5 years old, I love doing this!
AHHHHHH!
Oh my gosh!

Now we are going to cut our olives into thin
strips, we will need 5 strips for

each bird. I’m gonna be cutting strips into about
1/2 of my olives and I’m gonna be saving
the other 1/2 for my eye decorations.

Then you’re gonna take your 363 tip, and
we’re gonna be cutting the pupils.
Remember, each bird will need 2 of them!

We have ready our olive decorations, and now,
we are gonna cut the cheese!
Ah-hah-hah-hah, wah-wah!

So you’re gonna take your white cheese,
I’m using provolone, take your #2A Tip and

we’re gonna cut out a bunch of circles,
every bird will need 2.
Now we’re gonna move on to our cheddar cheese!

Gonna place him onto the cutting board, and
I’m gonna take these small, leaf shaped
cookie cutter, just a very mini 1.

If you don’t have 1 of these, you can just
use a sharp cutting knife and eyeball it,
cut out little beak shapes.

We got our little cheddar leaf shapes, and
now we’re gonna make them look like beaks!

With a sharp cutting knife, be really careful,
we’re just gonna cut a little triangle

here at the end. Then we’re gonna take our
little Babybels and, see these 2 little

tabs, if you pull them, just like this the
wax will come off, but too much

white will show. So what you’re gonna do
is cut off the tabs, and then you can see,

right on top of the tab pull line, we’re
gonna take a sharp cutting knife and cut
along the top of it.
We’re gonna go all the way around our cheese.

Once you’ve cut into the wax, now we’re
going to very gently pull off the bottom.
Da-dew!

We’ve got our Babybels ready and now we’re
gonna cut out extra shapes from the wax.

You’re gonna take your mini leaf cutter,
again, cut out a bunch of these,
we need 1 leaf per bird.

Then take your sharp cutting knife
again and we're gonna cut them in 1/2 the long way.

We have prepped all of our decorations and
now it is time to assemble them.

I like this part! It’s the decorating. You’re
gonna take 1 of your crackers,

place it down, take a Babybel, place him,
not in the middle, but a little bit off to the side.

Then I’m gonna be adding 2 eyeballs, very
close together, then a little cheddar beak.

Then 2 olive pupils, 2 olive slices, for the
angry eyebrows. And then 3 slices

for the feathers, these you’re gonna put
off to the side.

Then we’re gonna take 2 of the red pieces of wax,
lay them over each other, just a bit,
and place them on the top, the final touch!
There he is, look how cute!
Ta-da!

Here are the Angry Bird cheese and crackers
that we made today!

I love this recipe because it’s simple,
it’s easy mode, and, they look adorable!
Look how cute!
Looking good red, looking good!

And, a big thank you to you guys for suggesting
something Angry Birds,

I think these are so adorable, and, I’m
so excited for the movie,
comes out in a few days.

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of these
treats on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram

and Tumblr, and if you guys make these treats,
please take a picture and send it to me!

I love seeing your baking creations! It just
makes my day, I get a big kick out of it!

If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
